turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm looking for some product recommendations. I have a budget of around $100.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I can definitely help with that. To give you the best recommendations, could you tell me what kind of products you're interested in?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm thinking about a new pair of headphones. Over-ear preferred. And I really don't want to go over $100.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, over-ear headphones under $100. I have a few options for you. Based on our popular items, you could consider the 'Audio-Technica ATH-M20x Professional Studio Monitor Headphones', or if you want more bass, the 'Skullcandy Hesh Evo Wireless Over-Ear Headphones'. Both are well-regarded and within your budget.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, I've heard of those. The Skullcandy ones seem interesting, but are they any good really? Reviews seem mixed.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: You are right, the reviews for the Skullcandy can be mixed. Some users find the bass overwhelming. For a more balanced sound profile and better overall reviews, the Audio-Technicas are generally considered a better choice, especially if you plan to listen to a variety of music genres. I can search for some reviews if you like. Also, it is worth noting that we also have a number of more premium brands and options available as well, if you want to consider adjusting your budget.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that makes sense. But if I were to consider a slightly higher budget, what's the *absolute* best over-ear headphone I could get for under $150? Assuming sound quality is the main consideration.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a great question. At that price point, the 'Sennheiser HD 400S' or the 'AKG K240 STUDIO' are both excellent choices for sound quality. They offer a more neutral sound signature which is suitable for a wide range of musical styles. The AKG offers a slightly wider soundstage, but it depends on your personal preference. You would likely want to test them at a store to get the best fit!

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Perfect! Thanks, that's really helpful. I think I'll check those out. I appreciate the help!
